main event: A witness observed a large silvery object overhead in Flushing, New York on August 16, 1961.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for about 10 minutes.,The object was described as the size of a pinhead.,The direction of movement was from West to East.,It was tentatively identified as man-made satellite debris based on its appearance and motion.,The witness was a 15-year-old male, a student with some scientific background.
